activities:
ZIP Mailing utilizes data provided to us by our clients in order to fulfill their mailing needs.  We receive data files from our clients via email, diskettes, FTP transfer, and/or hard copy (pre-printed labels).  The data that passes through ZIP Mailing Services, Inc. is not enhanced, individually viewed or collected, or put to use for any other purpose than the fulfillment of each client’s mailings according to their exact specifications.
 
The personal data we typically accumulate from our clients is basic mailing information, such as name, address, city, state/country, and zip code, in order to select, format, and produce mailing lists for the purpose of performing mass mailings for those clients.
When we are in control of a client’s data files, we strive to protect those files and safeguard them from access by unauthorized individuals.  Strict procedures are in place regarding access to, and the security of, the company’s LAN Network.  Firewalls, passwords, and user-level security measures help to ensure that outside access is prohibited, and internal access is appropriately restricted, thereby keeping the client’s data secure and private.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: off-line; FTP; email; on-line; & manually processed data.
recoursemech:
If we are unable to satisfactorily address your data privacy concerns, you may contact the Direct Marketing Association’s Safe Harbor Line at: safeharbor@the-dma.org, 202-861-2410 or by mailing The DMA at:
